speech.value: This is ‘94, ‘95. And so, I switched to be a computer science and math major. And I mean, it’s almost both directions. I said, well, math is even purer than physics. Physics to some degree is based on our perceptions of things, although not fully. Obviously, at some point it just boils down to math, and, you know, we conceptualize it with our perceptions. And then – but I said, you know, computer science seems like a lot of interesting things in it these days.
